title: Inside Gaza with the Israeli army as it hunts for Hamas tunnels
summary: Le Monde was able to enter Gaza for two hours on Wednesday to follow an Israeli military unit. In the bomb-ravaged town of Beit Hanoun, Israeli soldiers are concentrating their operations on the underground tunnels which, they believe, lead to Hamas's headquarters in the center of Gaza City.

title: Russia withdraws from two arms treaties and tests a ballistic missile
summary: Moscow revoked its ratification of the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty (CTBT) after also confirming its withdrawal from the Treaty on Conventional Armed Forces in Europe, which was intended to turn the page on the Cold War.

title: Galthié opens up on 'scar' of failing to win Rugby World Cup
summary: Hosts France were one of the favorites to win the tournament but lost a thrilling quarter-final 29-28 to the eventual champions. 'For us, it was a time of mourning,' said French coach Fabien Galthié who has not spoken to the press since the night of the loss on October 15.

title: Mexico is online scammers' favorite playground
summary: Some 15,000 bank frauds take place every day in the country, where 15% of the population has already fallen victim to a scam. But nothing has been put into place to fight the phenomenon.

title: Scientists make heads, instead of tails, of starfish anatomy
summary: An international study has unraveled the age-old mystery: that the echinoderm has no tail or trunk, just a head.

title: 'As human rights activists and journalists, we demand the immediate release of Narges Mohammadi, the 2023 Nobel Peace Prize laureate who is now on hunger strike'
summary: Every hour that passes is now a matter of life and death for Iranian journalist Narges Mohammadi, as the Nobel laureate, on a hunger strike, has just been rushed to hospital. A group of human rights defenders calls for her release in an open letter in Le Monde.

title: Top court approves deportation of Palestinian activist Mariam Abudaqa from France
summary: The activist from the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, an organization classified as terrorist by the European Union, had arrived legally in France for a series of conferences.

title: Disney+ adds seven million subscribers, amid cost-cutting campaign
summary: In results released Wednesday, Disney said the company was pushing to cut costs by $7.5 billion, an increase from a previous pledge of $5.5 billion. In all, the entertainment giant posted sales of $21.24 billion for the period, up slightly on the previous year.

title: Ivanka Trump testifies she wasn't involved in documents central to her father's civil fraud trial
summary: The former president's daughter, took the stand Wednesday in the fraud trial against the family business and said she was not involved in the drawing up of the financial statements at the heart of the case.

title: French far right's attendance at rally against anti-Semitism causes discomfort
summary: Marine Le Pen, whose father was repeatedly convicted for anti-Semitic remarks, plans to attend Sunday's demonstration against anti-Semitism, called for by the presidents of the Assemblée Nationale and the Sénat. Many political leaders are uneasy at the thought of seeing her and her party there.

title: Polish truckers block Ukraine border crossings as tensions grow over imports
summary: Polish truckers' organizations have blocked three border crossings between the two countries, denouncing 'unfair competition' from their Ukrainian counterparts.

title: Abortion rights prove again to be winning electoral issue for US Democrats
summary: Ohio voters decided by a comfortable majority on November 7 to enshrine the right to abortion in the state's constitution, reassuring Democrats of their ability to rally mass support.

title: Iran: French national sentenced to 5 years in jail
summary: Banking consultant Louis Arnaud was sentenced on national security charges, his family stated, joining three other French citizens detained in Iran.

title: Tunisian president makes U-turn on law to criminalize normalizing relations with Israel
summary: The Tunisian Parliament suspended its debate on the bill after President Kaies Saied objected to it.

title: Olympics 2024: French Polynesia president suggests replanning surfing venue
summary: Following local opposition to the construction of a metal tower for judges at the famous surfing venue of Teahupo'o, President Moetai Brotherson suggested Taharuu Beach as an alternative.

title: Sarkozy appeal trial for campaign overspending opens
summary: The former president was initially sentenced to one year's imprisonment for spending well above the legal ceiling for campaign spending in the presidential election 2012.

title: EU Commission recommends opening membership talks with Ukraine and Moldova
summary: The European Union's executive arm also recommended granting Georgia the status of a candidate country. The decisions lie with the 27 member states.

title: Governments plan twice as much fossil fuel production in 2030 as recommended
summary: A report by the United Nations and various research organizations reveals the extent to which the projects of the main coal, oil and gas producing countries are out of step with the scenarios for limiting warming to 1.5°C.

title: Crisis over for Europe’s Ariane-6 rocket
summary: After two years of tension between France and Germany, a financial agreement guaranteeing the operation of the future launcher was reached on Monday, at a meeting of the 22 member states of the European Space Agency.

title: Hollywood actors and studios reach tentative deal to end strike
summary: The Screen Actors Guild (SAG-AFTRA) called off its 118-day strike from midnight on Thursday after finally reaching an agreement with the likes of Disney and Netflix for a new contract including higher pay, and protections against the use of artificial intelligence.

title: 'In the United States, oil is flowing without any need for investment while renewables are struggling'
summary: 'Le Monde' columnist Arnaud Leparmentier notes that while wind and solar power projects are suffering due to rising interest rates, Americans are extracting more and more fossil fuels from their soil.

title: House Republicans subpoena Biden family members in impeachment inquiry
summary: The subpoenas targeting President Joe Biden's son Hunter and his brother James stem from an as-yet fruitless yearlong investigation into what Republicans claim is 'influence peddling.'

title: Picasso's 'Woman with a Watch' fetches $139 million at auction
summary: It's the second-highest price ever achieved for the artist. The 1932 painting depicts one of Picasso's companions and muses, the French painter Marie-Thérèse Walter.

title: In Gaza, Swedish dual nationals feel abandoned
summary: More than 400 citizens of the Nordic kingdom are currently in the Gaza Strip. None of them have yet been evacuated. Their relatives are outraged by what they perceive as inaction on the part of the far-right Swedish government.

title: Gazan hospitals at the heart of Israel-Hamas war
summary: Since October 7, healthcare workers in the Palestinian enclave have been performing in extreme conditions. Israel claims the hospitals, which house thousands of refugees, are being used as cover for Hamas's military operations.

title: Israeli-Hamas war: Macron makes risky gamble of hosting conference on Gaza humanitarian aid
summary: Hastily organized, the meeting is due to bring together some 80 countries and NGOs anxious to respond to the needs of Palestinian civilians, but with no guarantee that assistance will be sent.

title: Myroslav Marynovych: 'Russians should organize concrete action against the war'
summary: The Ukrainian figure of Soviet dissidence, speaking to Le Monde, believes the first duty of Russian opponents of to the war in Ukraine is to act to change the situation in their country.

title: Amazon faces legal action for homophobic chants broadcast during PSG match
summary: During the September 24 match between PSG and Marseille, thousands of PSG supporters chanted homophobic slurs referring to their opponents. Four PSG players were given suspended one-match bans for joining in the chants.

title: The Trump family's financial trickery goes on trial in New York
summary: Donald Trump is accused of artificially inflating his assets to secure substantial loans at advantageous rates from his bankers. On Wednesday, his daughter Ivanka took the stand.
